channel.title: supernovae: individual: DES14X2fna on Chris Frohmaier
channel.description: Recent content in supernovae: individual: DES14X2fna on Chris Frohmaier

item.title: Understanding the extreme luminosity of DES14X2fna
item.description: We present DES14X2fna, a high-luminosity, fast-declining Type IIb supernova (SN IIb) at redshift z = 0.0453, detected by the Dark Energy Survey (DES). DES14X2fna is an unusual member of its class, with a light curve showing a broad, luminous peak reaching M_r ≃ -19.3 mag 20 d after explosion. This object does not show a linear decline tail in the light curve until ≃60 d after explosion, after which it declines very rapidly (4.
